case_vignette:
A 61-year-old woman presents concerned about a white discoloration on her left breast that she first noticed 6 months earlier. It itches at times, and she is worried it might be cancerous. She showed it to her gynecologist at her annual visit, and he referred her to the dermatology clinic. Physical examination of the left breast reveals a 10-cm white, smooth, porcelain-like plaque. There is no associated erythema and no noticeable scale. The patient is otherwise healthy, with no significant medical history. She is a nonsmoker and has no family history of cancer. The patient is concerned about the possibility of breast cancer, but the dermatologist is more concerned about the possibility of a benign condition such as a dermatosis or a fungal infection.

The patient is concerned about the possibility of breast cancer, but the dermatologist is more concerned about the possibility of a benign condition such as a dermatosis or a fungal infection.

question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a white discoloration on my left breast that sometimes itches.
How long have you noticed the discoloration?
I first noticed it 6 months ago.
Have you noticed any changes in size or shape of the discolored area since you first saw it?
No, there have been no changes in the size or shape of the discolored area.
Do you have any similar patches of discoloration on other parts of your body?
No, I do not have any similar patches of discoloration on other parts of my body.
Does anyone in your family have similar skin issues or any known skin diseases?
No, there is no family history of similar skin issues or known skin diseases.
Have you used any new soaps, lotions, or other products that could have come into contact with the affected area?
No, I have not used any new soaps, lotions, or other products that could have come into contact with the affected area.
Do you have any known allergies or other medical conditions?
No, I do not have any known allergies or other significant medical conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Vitiligo
